intro: Pedicularis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf lousewort, is a flowering plant native to alpine and subalpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spurred flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic species. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Pedicularis angustifolia is often found in rocky or open habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
